records.location_details: Migrants claim apprehension by Albanian authorities close to Durres, Albania, transported to a detention center near Kakavia, Albania, registered and fingerprinted. The next day, they were allegedly brought to a footpath near Kakavia, 5-minute walk from the BCP, and 'pushed' back to Greece. Interview took place in Delvinaki, Greece.
records.where_clear: Near Durres and Kakavia, Albania, and Delvinaki, Greece
records.location_text_raw: close to Durres (Albania), detention center close to Kakavia (Albanian side of the border), footpath near Kakavia (Albania), Delvinaki (Greece)
records.geocodable_query: Durres, Albania; Kakavia, Albania; Delvinaki, Greece

possible_violations.legal_basis: Art. 4 of Protocol no. 4 of the European Convention on Human Rights

possible_violations.violation_name: prohibition of inhuman or degrading treatment
possible_violations.legal_basis: Article 3 of the European Convention on Human Rights

records.context_note: Two migrants claim they were apprehended by Albanian authorities near Durres, transported to a detention center near Kakavia, registered, fingerprinted, and then brought to a footpath near Kakavia and 'pushed' back to Greece. The Fundamental Rights Office could not establish a fundamental rights violation due to limited information.
records.evidence_quote: Two migrants claim that they were apprehended by Albanian authorites close to Durres (Albania) on 01/03/2022 and brought to a detention center close to Kakavia where they were registered and fingerprinted. In the morning of 02/03/2022, they were allegedly brought by Albanian authorities to a footpath in an abandoned area, near Kakavia, 5-minute walk from the BCP and "pushed" them back to Greece.
